summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to AT&T Corporation, seeking extensive subscriber records for specific IP addresses. It is part of a criminal investigation into violations of federal statutes including conspiracy, false statements, and obstruction of justice, and includes a request for confidentiality.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena and accompanying letter requesting confidentiality of the investigation.

events.title: Grand Jury Appearance Date for AT&T
events.description: The subpoena commands AT&T to appear before a federal grand jury to produce records or testify.

events.title: Subpoena Issued
events.description: The grand jury subpoena is dated and issued to AT&T Corporation's National Compliance Center.

locations: National Compliance Center AT&T Corporation, 11760 U.S. Highway 1, North Palm Beach, FL 33408
United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Manhattan, New York, NY
U.S. Attorney's Office, 1 St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: The subpoena seeks extensive AT&T subscriber data for specific IP addresses, including identifying info, payment details, call records, and account logs from January 1, 2014 onward.
The investigation concerns alleged violations of 18 U.S.C. §§ 371 (conspiracy), 1001 (false statements), 1519 (obstruction), and 2 (aiding and abetting).
The U.S. Attorney's office requested AT&T voluntarily keep the subpoena confidential to avoid impeding the investigation.
The document is part of a federal grand jury proceeding in the Southern District of New York in August 2019.
